chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: A merger is when two firms agree to integrate their operations on a relatively co-equal basis. Acquisition is when a firm buys a controlling, or 100% interest in another firm to make the acquired firm a subsidiary business within its portfolio.

chapters.title: Why does it happen?
chapters.text: Reasons for acquiring a firm include increased market power, overcoming entry barriers, lower risk than developing new products, increased diversification, and developing new capabilities.

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: An example of a successful acquisition is Facebook & WhatsApp. It was the 9th largest M&A in 2014, costing $22 billion.
